content: Changed True/False to Same/Different according to https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/contribution-guidelines The output will still be binary, but at least it doesn't favor Python in shortest.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This is quite difficult! Took me a while to handle all the wacky edge cases. But I think it’s adds a great variety to the game.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: The description is very clear and test cases cover everything.
Solved in Python. 
Perfect for all 3 game modes.

By popular demand, I extended the puzzle to Fastest and Shortest as well. Please check the wording! I tried to keep it short, so I might have missed clarifying some ambiguities in the constraints of the problem.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I make solution in java, and i liked it so much. I think its great for reverse maybe for fastest and sortest too.
Excellent! I think this puzzle also can be good for "fastest" and "smallest" modes

Keep in mind that users will not see the Validators. Those are meant to behave identically to the Tests for most algorithms being tested.

That means for a true/false output, the test and validator pairs should have the same output.

It also means users have half as much information as we do in this WIP setup. Four tests are often not enough for reverse mode.

I think you need to add smaller examples to really illustrates the goal of the challenge
It's still a very nice idea !
I think it'll be ready for submission after few new smaller examples ;)
